eu.cqse.check.framework.preprocessor.abap

Class AbapPreprocessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.preprocessor.abap.AbapPreprocessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPreprocessor

    public class AbapPreprocessor
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPreprocessor
    Preprocessor for ABAP. It rolls out so-called "chain sentences" in order to make parsing easier. For example, the following two code snippets are equivalent:
    • DATA: a TYPE i, b TYPE x.
    • DATA a TYPE i. DATA b TYPE x.
    Basically, whenever there is a colon, this means that every statement after a comma begins with whatever came before the colon.

      • isGeneratedFromAbapKettensatzStatement

        public static boolean isGeneratedFromAbapKettensatzStatement(UnmodifiableList<IToken> includedTokens)
        Returns whether these tokens have been generated by the ABAP Preprocessor during a "Kettensatz" expansion. The expansion allows to write code like this: one two three : four five, six seven. which is expanded to one two three four five. one two three six seven. Of course, more segments are allowed and each segment can contain one or more tokens. Imporant are the colon, commas, and dot. Common use case: WRITE: x = 5, y = 1.
